column4: wanted to know how to enable applications like Pigdin & Firestarter to start up when logged on
Hello, how do i start up the Firestarter & Pidgin @ startup ?
ï»¿Hello, how do i start up the Firestarter & Pidgin @ startup ?
jenal: tried that, every time gives the message "insufficient privilages"
@ nataneal: no such options in the system > admin menu
and if your trying to  run firestarter, and it's not providing a gksudo prompt then your obviously not the admin of that machine
if you are the admin, then try running it via the run-dialogue(alt+f2 : then type : gksudo firestarter )
this isnt a recommended way of using firestarter. i take it you want this so people can see when incoming traffic is being blocked?
it is, firestarter is just a gui. it controls the firewall called iptables
have you put pidgin in the session list?
yep, everysingle firewall gui you see for ubuntu is almost always going to be a frontend.
no did not have pidgin program in the list. am adding that now. Thanks for clearing up that. I thought firestarter was a firewall itself.
nope, it may appear to be because of certain wording in the app itself, but its just a interface...iptables is horrid to learn directly
ufw is a good terminal based iptables frontend, i recommend it if your going to need to control a ubuntu server that has no screen or desktop enviroment
Thanks & have a great day. Bye
